questions.question_text: A month after a company purchased and implemented system and performance monitoring software, reports were too large and therefore were not reviewed or acted upon. The MOST effective plan of action would be to:

choices.B: use analytical tools to produce exception reports from the system and performance monitoring software.
choices.A: evaluate replacement systems and performance monitoring software.
choices.D: restrict functionality of system monitoring software to security-related events.
choices.C: re-install the system and performance monitoring software.

comments.content: The tool is meant to monitor system performance. How will you do that if you filter only security events? Answer is B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
So the reports are too large to be reviewed and addressed, so the best option is to limit the functionality of the system monitoring software to security-related events.

Option B. 
Using analytical tools to produce exception reports allows for the identification and extraction of critical information or anomalies from the large volume of data generated by the monitoring software. Exception reports focus on highlighting deviations, thresholds breaches, or significant events that require immediate attention or action.

By implementing exception reporting, the company can filter out non-essential information and focus on the most important and relevant data points. This helps address the problem of large reports overwhelming the review process and enables timely and effective monitoring of critical events or issues. - ChatGPT and it makes a lot of sense

Selected Answer: B
is the B

The most effective plan of action would be to use analytical tools to produce exception reports from the system and performance monitoring software. Exception reports highlight deviations from normal behavior and can be more manageable to review and act upon than large, comprehensive reports. Options A and C are not effective because they do not address the issue of the reports being too large. Option D may help to reduce the volume of reports, but it is not as effective as using analytical tools to produce exception reports.

questions.question_text: Which of the following practices associated with capacity planning provides the GREATEST assurance that future incidents related to existing server performance will be prevented?

choices.B: Reviewing results from simulated high-demand stress test scenarios
choices.A: Duplicating existing disk drive systems to improve redundancy and data storage
choices.C: Performing a root cause analysis for past performance incidents
choices.D: Anticipating current service level agreements (SLAs) will remain unchanged

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Of the following capacity planning practices, the one that provides the greatest assurance of preventing future incidents related to the performance of existing servers is B. Review the results of simulated high-demand stress test scenarios.

Reasons:
Proactive assessment: Stress testing proactively assesses how a server will react to high-load conditions, thus preventing future performance issues.
Understanding limitations: Testing can identify system limitations and bottlenecks so that necessary remedial measures can be implemented.
While root cause analysis is important, the proactive approach of stress testing provides more direct assurance of preventing future problems.

Selected Answer: B
This is B.

comments.content: Let me expand a little. In reading the question it specifically states UAT. Therefore, if proper UAT did not take place then it will not meet the system functions. We are concerned with the functionality because of poor UAT. Not security.

discussion.content:

B. System functions may not meet business requirements.

It is B.

A. Defects: While defects are a concern, UAT primarily focuses on ensuring the system fulfills its intended purpose according to user needs. Unforeseen defects might still exist, but untested functionalities related to business requirements are a bigger risk.

The core purpose of UAT is to validate if the system fulfills the needs of the users and aligns with the business goals. Untested key scenarios raise the biggest concern that the system might not be meeting those expectations.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor learns that a business owner violated the organization's security policy by creating a web page with access to production data. The auditor's NEXT step should be to:

choices.B: assess the sensitivity of the production data.
choices.C: determine if sufficient access controls exist.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Option A escalate to top management because it is a policy violation. Senior management needs to be aware of the situation to assess the risks and take appropriate corrective actions.
